intro: Ormocarpum drakei, commonly known as Drake's ormocarp, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed capsule that splits open to release seeds. Ormocarpum drakei is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
